head.title: Corporate Equity Offerings Set for the Week

hedline.hl1: Corporate Equity Offerings Set for the Week

block.p: The following equity and convertible debt offerings are expected this week:

Advanced Semiconductor Engineering Inc., Taiwan, an initial public offering of 20 million American depository shares, each depository share represents 5 shares. Goldman, Sachs & Co. and Morgan Stanley Dean Witter.
The following equity and convertible debt offerings are expected this week:

Advanced Semiconductor Engineering Inc., Taiwan, an initial public offering of 20 million American depository shares, each depository share represents 5 shares. Goldman, Sachs & Co. and Morgan Stanley Dean Witter.
Aristotle International Inc., Washington, an initial public offering of two million shares. WR Hambrecht.
At Road Inc., Fremont, Calif., an initial public offering of seven million shares. Credit Suisse First Boston.
AvantGo Inc., San Mateo, Calif., an initial public offering of 5.5 million shares. Credit Suisse First Boston.
Ciphergen Biosystems Inc., Palo Alto, Calif., an initial public offering of five million shares. SG Cowen.
CoSine Communications Inc., Redwood City, Calif., an initial public offering of 10 million shares. Goldman, Sachs & Co.
Delcath Systems Inc., Stamford, Conn., an initial public offering of two million shares. Whale Securities.
Docent Inc., Mountain View, Calif., an initial offering of eight million shares. Deutsche Bank Alex. Brown.
Durect Corp., Cupertino, Calif., an initial public offering of seven million shares. Morgan Stanley Dean Witter.
EDEN Bioscience Corp., Bothell, Wash., an initial public offering of 5.8 million shares. Merrill Lynch & Co.
Elastic Networks Inc., Alpharetta, Ga., an initial public offering of 7.8 million shares. Chase Bank Hambrecht & Quist.
General Dynamics Inc., Falls Church, Va., 15 million shares. Goldman, Sachs & Co.
Genomica Corp., Boulder, Colo., an initial public offering of five million shares. CIBC Wood Gundy.
Grupo Aeroportuario del Sureste S.A., Southeast Airport Group, Mexico, an initial public offering of 22.1 million American depository shares, each depository share represents 10 series B shares.
Head N.V., Rotterdam, the Netherlands, an initial public offering of 20.8 million ordinary shares. Morgan Stanley Dean Witter.
Hydril Co., Houston, an initial public offering of 7.5 million shares. Salomon Smith Barney and Credit S First Boston.
Information Corp., Palo Alto, Calif., 2.5 million shares. Morgan Stanely Dean Witter and Credit Suisse First Boston.
InforMax Inc., Rockville, Md., an initial public offering of five million shares. Bear, Stearns & Co.

Intershop Communications A.G., Hamburg, Germany, an initial public offering of 3.4 million American depository shares, each depository share represents a half of one bearer ordinary share. Credit Suisse First Boston.
Neopharm Inc., Bannockburn, Ill., three million shares. Prudential and US Bancorp Piper Jaffray.
Nuance Communications Inc., Menlo Park, Calif., three million shares. Goldman, Sachs & Co.
Penton Media Inc., Cleveland, 3.6 million shares. Donaldson, Lufkin & Jenrette.
Protein Design Labs Inc., Fremont, Calif., 2.5 million shares. Credit Suisse First Boston.
Proton Energy Systems Inc., Rocky Hill, Conn., an initial public offering of seven million shares. Morgan Stanley Dean Witter.
Radiance Medical Systems Inc., Irvine, Calif., 2.8 million shares. Prudential Securities and Gruntal & Co.
Simple Technology Inc., Santa Ana, Calif., an initial public offering of 6.4 million shares. Lehman Brothers.
Southern Energy Inc., Atlanta, an initial public offering of 58 million shares. Goldman, Sachs & Co. and Morgan Stanley Dean Witter.
Vastera Inc., Dulles, Va., an initial public offering of six million shares. Deutsche Bank Alex. Brown.
Victory Entertainment Corp., Orlando, Fla., an initial public offering of 2.3 million shares. Weatherly.
WebSideStory Inc., San Diego, an initial public offering of three million shares. Lehman Brothers.
Wilson Greatbatch Technologies Inc., Clarence, N.Y., an initial public offering of 4.7 million shares. Donalson, Lufkin & Jenrette and Merrill Lynch & Co.
